like climate and and weather simulations working with people in the energy industry trying to figure out what does

modeling more on the like scientific Computing side was was AI even in the

wait why should I use gaming technology to do real science yeah and it seems
kind of like just a strange question these days where some of the most important scientific challenges of our
time are being addressed using not only this this gaming technology but what has
grown into into a more general purpose parallel Computing platform the application of uh this parallel
Computing technology to AI happened several years later and it really came
again from the research sector where there were a small number of researchers who had somehow managed to maintain

have come to call Deep learning and they were building what at the time seemed to
be really large complicated neural networks that had
very simple amounts of processing in each node and this was a very different approach from what had been done

that these GPU parallel processors were almost ideally
suited for accelerating the work of training these

the Genesis of the deep learning AI Revolution that we're all witnessing

this realization came from the research Community initially when they started thinking more about accelerating these
AI workflows on the gpus um or the graphics cards so at what point Did you

where industry people started you know really expressing this desire for GPU
accelerated machines and and that sort of thing uh you know out of research and

very fortunate that those initial researchers decided to publish not only
their their results in research papers but they published the software that they used to train the Deep neural
network models the things that we call Deep learning Frameworks today you know one of the early ones there was Cafe and
torch now P torch tensor flow mxet these you know there are some called paddle
paddle and these Frameworks being available in the open source Community
but really just being available at all allowed all of us to start to experiment
with them and what we observed happening was a very early on in the process the cloud service providers who had adopted
gpus into their offerings very quickly recognized that
this deep learning technology was going to be not only valuable to their own businesses but a valuable new type of
workload that allowed them to offer more compute services to their customers and
grow their cloud computing business and so you saw new types of of
instances new types of servers being offered by the cloud service providers and prepackaged virtual machine images
basically the operating system and all that the software that you run on these servers on the cloud service provider
platforms prepackaged and ready to go all you had to do was you know click a few buttons and you had a server with
gpus and all the software you needed ready to start running and and training your models on on your data so that Lit
a uh fire really especially in the startup Community where up until then
the cost of you know buying your own Data Center and getting everything set up was pretty prohibitive to small
startups now they could just very quickly rent all of the compute capability they needed and most of the
software was already set up for them to start exploring all the innovative ideas that startups come up with every time a
new new technology is released and we also in that time frame saw a number of
let's say forward-thinking Enterprise organizations and government agencies
began to take advantage of these capabilities where they saw there was a
good business opportunity either to improve their own internal business operations and practices or to build new
